sentences.en: A crafty knave needs no broker.
sentences.cn: 狡猾的无赖无需中间人.

sentences.en: A primrose doublet, fortune's knave, smiled on my fear.
sentences.cn: 身穿淡黄色心的命运之奴仆, 看到我的恐惧,泛出微笑.

sentences.en: Better be a fool than a knave.

sentences.cn: 早早当老爷, 未久为仆役.

sentences.en: He hid a knave of hearts in his pocket.
sentences.cn: 他把一张红桃J藏在口袋里.

sentences.en: He was an angel on the surface, but at heart a knave.
sentences.cn: 他表面上是个天使, 实际上却是个无赖.

sentences.en: It is that knave who answers in my heart.
sentences.cn: 那个坏蛋却在我心中响应.

sentences.en: Once a knave, always a knave.
sentences.cn: 一次耍无赖, 终身臭名在.

sentences.en: Once a knave, ever a knave.
sentences.cn: 一次成无赖, 永远是无赖.

sentences.en: The honest man take pain, and then enjoy pleasure ; the knave take pleasure, and then suffer pain.
sentences.cn: 君子先苦后甜; 人小先甜后苦.

sentences.en: The Knave shook his head sadly.'Do I look like it?'he said.
sentences.cn: 武士伤心地摇摇头说: “ 我像会游水的 吗 ?”

sentences.en: We set him down as either a knave or a fool.
sentences.cn: 我们认为他是个无赖要不然就是蠢蛋.

sentences.en: We should set him down as neither a knave nor a fool.
sentences.cn: 我们既不应该把他视为无赖,也不该把他看作傻瓜.

sentences.en: You look a fool at the best, and a knave at worst.
sentences.cn: 你呀,说好呢不过像个傻瓜, 说坏呢不过像个流氓.

trans.tran_cn: 恶棍，无赖，（纸牌中的）杰克
